entry.title: Taking a REST with Apache mod_actions
entry.summary: REST has reached critical mass. And the war between REST and SOAP is over.

div.p: I've been working with the REST paradigm for years. Or that is what I've claimed. But really, what I've been delivering is really GETful web services. These are services delivering all services using GET-requests, which good if you're actually just delivering content.

table.caption: Tab. 1. The methods defined in HTTP 1.1. Safe methods should not take any other action than retrieval. An idempotent method is one that has the same side effects if it is applied n times (n>0), as when it it is applied once.

div.p: You can do a lot using REST and the set of methods defined for HTTP 1.1. I've put the method in Tab. 1. Before we start discussing Apache and how to implement the more esoteric methods practically I'd like to dwell on the idempotency concept.
